newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican jobs lost in crisis now recovered-Zedillo.
newsitem.headline: Mexican jobs lost in crisis now recovered-Zedillo.

text.p: Mexico's President Ernesto Zedillo said Thursday that virtually all the jobs lost during the worst of the country's economic crisis have now been recovered.
"Today we can say that practically all the jobs lost during the most critical part of the crisis have been recovered," Zedillo said during a tour of the northern state of Coahuila.
He gave no specific figures but said Mexico still had to create a million jobs a year just to keep pace with the growing working population.
More than a million people are believed to have lost their jobs in the severe recession Mexico went through following the December 1994 peso crisis.
Mexico this week reported second-quarter GDP growth of 7.2 percent compared to the second quarter of last year, however.
Zedillo said earlier this week that the figure showed the economy is now "clearly in a phase of expansion".
